caption.p: Correlates of protection. Circulating NT 50 antibody titers following antibody transfer in protected and not protected mice are shown in (a). The geomean is indicated by a horizontal bar. The dotted line represents a NT 50 titer of 125. The *** symbol indicates a p value of <Â 0.001 as determined using the Wilcoxon Mann-Whitney test. Panel (b) shows the correlation relationship between NT 50 antibody titer and circulating viral RNA at 2 post-infection. In Fig. 6a and b, the protected mice are indicated by red circles and the mice succumbing to infection are indicated by black circles. The coefficient of determination (R 2) was determined using linear regression analysis.
